properties.name: Adam Run Trail
properties.description: One of the park district's most demanding hikes; forms a sort of figure eight with Spring Hollow Trail. Travels through ravines and over streams.

properties.name: Akron Northside Connector to the Towpath Trail
Albermarle Connector Trail
properties.description: Gorge Metro Park connector trail to the neighborhoods to the north and east of the park.

properties.name: Alder Trail
properties.conditions: At the start of the trail, a short (half-mile, round trip) section is good for users with wheelchairs, walkers, canes and strollers.
properties.description: Alder Trail leads through the woods to Alder Pond, where a cattail marsh provides good wildlife habitat.

properties.name: Alexander Road to Egbert Picnic Area Bridle Section
Alexander Road to Egbert Picnic Area Buckeye Section
Alexander Road to Egbert Picnic Area Shared Section
Bacci Park Aqueduct to West Canal Road
Big Bend Connector
properties.description: Connects to the Towpath Trail.

properties.name: Bike & Hike Connector
properties.description: Bike & Hike Connector extends the Bike & Hike Trail to connect the northern and southern legs of the Bike & Hike Trail.

properties.name: Bike & Hike Trail
properties.conditions: All 34 miles of the Bike & Hike trail are paved.
properties.description: All 34 miles of the Bike & Hike trail are paved. Some portions of the trail use neighborhood streets. Please follow the green biking signs until you rejoin the established trail. For your convenience, restrooms are located at the Brandywine Falls, SR 303, Springdale, Silver Springs and SR 91 lots.

properties.name: Bike & Hike Trail Boston Mills Road Connector
Bike & Hike Trail Brandywine Falls Connector
Bike & Hike Trail Connector at SR 303
Blue Hen Falls Trail Shared Buckeye Section
Boston to Pine Lane Shared Section
Boston to Pine Lane Towpath Buckeye Shared Section
Boston to Pine Lane Towpath Shared Section
Brandywine Falls to Boston Mills Road
Brandywine Gorge Trail and Bike & Hike Shared Section
Bridle Trail
properties.description: The Bridle Trail at Silver Creek Metro Park is the only horseback trail managed by Metro Parks, Serving Summit County.

properties.name: Buckeye Trail Boston Store to Pine Lane
Buckeye Trail Connector from Pine Lane to Towpath
Buttonbush Trail
properties.description: The trail follows an old service road, where vehicles once traveled to and from oil wells, last used in 2003. Today, you'll walk between two large buttonbush swamps. The trail's namesake, the buttonbush, is a flowering shrub that grows in shallow water about one to two feet deep.

properties.name: Cherry Lane Trail
properties.description: Cherry Lane Trail is an easy-to-travel loop that connects to Fernwood Trail at a 110-foot-long suspension bridge, taking visitors across a 45-foot-deep ravine.

properties.name: Chippewa Trail
properties.description: Along Chippewa Trail, mature trees have grown from thousands of seedlings planted by Girl Scout troops between 1967 and 1983.

properties.name: Chuckery Trail
properties.conditions: Cross-country skiing is possible on the lower portion of the Chuckery Trail.
properties.description: This difficult trail gives hikers a glimpse of the Indian Signal Tree, reportedly shaped by American Indians, before passing the Cuyahoga River, crossing the parkway and heading uphill; then it loops back to the start.

properties.name: Connector Trail
properties.description: Gorge Connector Trail offers pedestrian entrance to the park from Front Street.

properties.name: Cross Country Trail and Lake Trail Shared Section
Daffodil Trail
properties.description: An estimated 40,000 daffodils -- including dozens of varieties -- bloom each spring along the H.S. Wagner Daffodil Trail, named for the park district's first director-secretary, who planted the first bulbs here in the late 1930s. Peak bloom is typically mid-April.

properties.name: Deer Run and Buckeye Shared Section
Deer Run Trail
properties.description: The challenging, and aptly-named, Deer Run Trail follows a path worn by white-tailed deer and provides scenic views of the Cuyahoga River Valley. How many steps do you count on the hike back to the top?

properties.name: Dogwood Trail
properties.description: Explore shady valley and ridge-top terrain along the wooded and challenging Dogwood Trail.

properties.name: Fernwood Trail
properties.description: Fernwood Trail is an easy-to-travel loop that connects to Cherry Lane Trail at a 110-foot-long suspension bridge, taking visitors across a 45-foot-deep ravine.

properties.name: Frazee House to Alexander Road Bridle Section
Frazee House to Alexander Road Buckeye Section
Frazee House to Station Road Bridge
Frazee House to Station Road Bridge Shared Section
Frazee House to Station Road Bridge Towpath Trail Sections
Freedom Trail
properties.description: The Freedom Trail travels 4.2 miles between the Middlebury Lot to Tallmadge Circle. When completed, this eight-mile multipurpose trail will connect Akron and Kent and become another popular linear park managed by Metro Parks, Serving Summit County.

properties.name: Glens Trail
properties.description: Glens Trail provides views from the edge of the Cuyahoga River. Springs flow from the ledges along this trail, providing water needed for liverwort.

properties.name: Gorge Trail
properties.description: Gorge Trail provides access to Mary Campbell Cave, an easy half-mile walk from the parking lot. At the start of the trail, a short (half-mile, round trip) section earns Class B status and is good for users with wheelchairs, walkers, canes and strollers. The trail quickly becomes more rugged as it passes through stunning rock-ledge formations. An upper section of the trail is even considered "primitive," earning Class D status.

properties.name: Harvard Road to Leonard Krieger Canalway Center
Highbridge Trail
properties.description: The moderate Highbridge Trail connects Gorge Metro Park and Cascade Valley Metro Park / South.

properties.name: Hunt Farm to Ira Towpath Buckeye Shared Section
Indian Spring Trail
properties.description: Inside the Lake Area, Indian Spring Trail loops through two types of forests and near wetlands, ponds, a stream and the trail's namesake, an old spring.

properties.name: Jaite to Boston Store Buckeye Section
Jogging Trail
properties.conditions: At the start of the trail, from the Old Portage Area, a one-mile (round trip) section earns Class B status and is good for users with wheelchairs, walkers, canes and strollers.
properties.description: The Parkway Jogging Trail is the most popular in the park district, averaging more than 1,000 users a day, year-round.

properties.name: Ledges to Haskell Run Connector Trail
Ledges to Pine Grove Connector Trails
Ledges Trail
properties.description: Visitors pass by a unique system of sandstone ledges, into Glacier Cave and to a wetland before traveling back to the trailhead over a long boardwalk. The ledges are covered by a "living skin." Ferns, mosses and lichens grow here, and endangered bats and other species live in the area. For the protection of natural resources, please stay on the trail.

properties.name: Leonard Krieger Canalway Center Connector Trail
Leonard Krieger Canalway Center To Bacci Park Aqueduct
Lock 29 to Hunt Farm Towpath Buckeye Shared Section
Lock 3 Park to Richard Howe House
Meadow Loop Trail
properties.description: The short Meadow Loop is a flat, easy trail in the Tallmadge Meadows Area that can be enjoyed by users with wheelchairs, walkers, canes and strollers.

properties.name: Meadow Trail
properties.description: From the parking lot of the Tallmadge Meadows Area, the Meadow Trail passes by the County Home cemetery and travels through woods, a shrub thicket, wetland woods and its namesake meadow. Several boardwalks help visitors traverse the wet areas.

properties.name: Mingo Trail
properties.description: The difficult Mingo Trail harbors a variety of wildlife and oak, beech and tulip trees. West of Shady Hollow Pavilion, the trail becomes quite rugged, earning Class D status.

properties.name: Neighborhood Connector
properties.description: Connects the Tallmadge Meadows Area to neighborhoods west of Darrow Road (SR 91).

properties.name: Nursing Home Connector
properties.description: Connects the Tallmadge Meadows Area to Heather Knoll Retirement Village.

properties.name: Oak Hill and Plateau Shared Sections
Old Mill Trail
properties.conditions: Dogs allowed in the lake area only.
properties.description: The trail takes hikers through beech-maple woods. Be sure to look for the Brush Family marker, which reads: "To all those who love as he loved the far sky and smiling land."

properties.name: Overlook Trail
properties.conditions: Good for users with wheelchairs, walkers, canes and strollers.
properties.description: The flat, easy Overlook Trail provides spectacular views of the Cuyahoga River, 125 feet below the Overlook Deck.

properties.name: Oxbow Trail
properties.conditions: Cross-country skiing is possible on the lower portions of the Oxbow Trail.
properties.description: The moderate Oxbow Trail provides welcome refuge from the everyday hustle and bustle of urban life.

properties.name: Parcours Trail
properties.description: For a good workout, try this challenging hiking trail with numbered exercise stations.

properties.name: Pheasant Run Trail
properties.description: The easy Pheasant Run Trail winds through fields and woods and around small ponds.

properties.name: Pine Grove Connector Trail to Lake Trail
Piney Woods Trail
properties.conditions: Dogs allowed in the lake area only.
properties.description: Although this trail is named for the many pines once planted in the park, they are giving way to a variety of other species through natural succession, including black cherries, oaks and tuliptrees.

properties.name: Prairie Trail
properties.description: Though the prairie will take years to fully develop, the easy Prairie Trail leads visitors from the parking lot into what could become a birding hotspot in just a few years.

properties.name: Quarry Trail
properties.description: Discarded mill stones are scattered along the moderate Quarry Trail, which takes visitors through the woods to an old quarry. You can also link to the Towpath Trail and take a short spur to the park's namesake, the deepest lock on the Ohio & Erie Canal.

properties.name: Redwing Trail
properties.conditions: Dogs allowed in the lake area only.
properties.description: Redwing Trail is an easy loop footpath that connects to the Willow Trail.

properties.name: Richard Howe House to Summit Lake
Rock Creek Trail
properties.conditions: Dogs allowed in the lake area only.
properties.description: The picturesque Rock Creek Trail leads hikers on a shaded, basic trail through beautiful beech-maple woods.
properties.photo_credit: Metro Parks and volunteer Jennie Levy

properties.name: Rock & Herb Garden
properties.description: An accessible section of the Seneca Trail travels through the Rock & Herb Garden.

properties.name: Schumacher Trail
properties.conditions: A picnic area is located near the parking lot.
properties.description: The hilly Schumacher Trail provides a closer look at some of Summit County's most pristine scenery.

properties.name: Seneca Trail
properties.description: Seneca Trail is a partly unpaved loop leading visitors past pines, a deciduous forest and through an open prairie. Portions of the trail may be considered strenuous due to hilly terrain.

properties.name: Spring Hollow Trail
properties.description: One of the park district's most demanding hikes; forms a sort of figure eight with Adam Run Trail. Travels through ravines and over streams and includes a 30-foot bridge.

properties.name: Stanford Trail
properties.description: Stanford Trail at the east end has Brandywine Falls and traveleing west goes by the youth hostel and to the Towpath Trail.

properties.name: Station Road Bridge to Red Lock
Station Road Bridge to Red Lock Buckeye Section
Station Road Bridge to Red Lock Shared Section
Station Road Bridge to Red Lock Valley Section
Stream Restoration Trail
properties.description: This trail takes you by the stream restoration project near Brushwood Lake.

properties.name: Sugarbush Trail
properties.description: Sugarbush Trail loops through the city-run recreation area. The distance measured does not include the walk around the ballfield to the trailhead. For more information, please call the city of Twinsburg's Parks & Recreation Department at 330-963-8722.

properties.name: Summit Lake Park to Wilbeth Road
Towpath Connector
properties.description: Deep Lock Quarry Towpath Connector Trail connects to the Towpath Trail.

properties.name: Valley and Langes Run Shared Sections
Valley Link Trail
properties.description: The moderate Valley Link Trail connect Sand Run Metro Park and Cascade Valley Metro Park / North.

properties.name: Valley Trail between Boston and Pine Lane
Valley Trail between Frazee House and Station Road Bridge
Valley Trail between Red Lock and Boston
Valley Trail between Red Lock and Station Road Bridge
Valley Trail Hunt Farm to Everett Covered Bridge
Valley Trail Pine Lane to Wetmore
Valley Trail Wetmore to Hunt Farm
Walking Trail
properties.description: The easy Walking Course is a favorite among seniors and young families. It passes the Tuscarawas Race and connects to Willow Trail.

properties.name: Weaver School Connector Trail
properties.description: Connects the Tallmadge Meadows Area to Weaver School.

properties.name: Wetmore Trail
properties.conditions: This land is accessible via bridle trails maintained by Cuyahoga Valley National Park.
properties.description: In addition to 14 developed parks and more than 125 miles of trails, Metro Parks manages several conservation areas for the purpose of preserving Summit Countys natural resources. In 1974, the National Park Service acquired thousands of acres that were managed by Metro Parks, including Virginia Kendall Park. Despite this acquisition, Metro Parks retained 572 wooded acres  todays Wetmore Conservation Area. It includes great forests, steep ravines and high-quality stream corridors. The land is accessible via bridle trails maintained by Cuyahoga Valley National Park.

properties.name: Willow Trail
properties.description: Willow Trail passes the Tuscarawas Race, Tuscarawas River and Little Turtle Pond, where young anglers 15 and under can fish.

properties.name: Wood Hollow Trail
properties.description: NOTE: Not yet open to the public. Wood Hollow's trail will travel past forests and wetlands.
properties.statustext: Not yet open to the public
